title: Understanding Behavioral Indicators
text: Behavioral indicators of self-harm often involve actions or habits that are meant to conceal injuries or facilitate self-harm. Consider what someone might do to hide evidence of self-harm or to have tools readily available.

hintAnswer: wearing long sleeves or pants even in warm weather to conceal injuries
title: Identifying Concealment Behaviors
text: What might someone wear to hide self-harm injuries, even if the weather is warm?
choices: wearing long sleeves or pants even in warm weather to conceal injuries
visible cuts, burns, or bruises, frequently observed on wrists, arms, thighs, or other less noticeable body parts
the structured evaluation of the risk factors associated with a person’s potential for engaging in a $$life-threatening$$ behavior, such as suicide

hintAnswer: the unexplained possession of sharp objects like knives or razors
title: Recognizing Possession of Tools
text: What might someone possess that could indicate self-harm?
choices: the unexplained possession of sharp objects like knives or razors
visible cuts, burns, or bruises, frequently observed on wrists, arms, thighs, or other less noticeable body parts
the structured evaluation of the risk factors associated with a person’s potential for engaging in a $$life-threatening$$ behavior, such as suicide
